result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Allan Altenburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Allan Altenburg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott Allan Altenburg was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 20CM38 and 20CF131

miscConds.notes: PAID IN FULL WITH CASH BOND.

Provide DNA sample within  30 days.
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
5 days credit if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED, to be used at the agent's discretion.
Concurrent with: 20CM38 and 20CF131

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Allan Altenburg

records.addlTxt: Defendant's JOC(s) and dismissal(s). Return to Sender. Not deliverable as addressed.
signed by Scott Altenburg and Atty Stormont

09:06 AM Defendant Scott Allan Altenburg in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 20CF131, 19CM253, 20CM38 and 22CF34. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1-2 in 20CF131, guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 20CM38, and guilty to Ct#3 22CF34. Dismiss 19CM253, Ct#1-2, 4-5 in 20CF344, Ct#3 in 20CF131 and Ct#2,4 in 20CM38. DJOC for Ct#1 in 20CF131, 2 years probation Ct#2 in 20CF131, Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 20CM38 and Ct#3 in 22CF34. ADA Walker recites reasons for DJOC- best interest for the public. Atty Stormont agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1-2 in 20CF131, Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 20CM38 and Ct#3 in 22CF34. Counsel stipulates to factual basis.   Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1-2 in 20CF131, Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 20CM38 and Ct#3 in 22CF34. Court dismisses 19CM253, Ct#3 in 20CF131, Ct#2 and Ct#4 in 20CM38 and Ct#1-2 and Ct#4-5 in 22CF34. ADA Walker and Atty Stormont address sentencing.  Court orders S/W 2 years probation to Ct#2 in 20CF131, Ct#1 and Ct#3 in 20CM38 and Ct#3 in 22CF34; concurrent- 60 days jail; stayed to be used at the agents discretion,  court costs ($443, except Ct#2 in 20CF131 $543), DNA sample within 30 days, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections..   Court withholds judgment of conviction of Ct#1 20CF131 in favor of the 2 year DJOC. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC and signs. 5 days jail credit in 22CF34. 1 day credit in 20CM38. Defendant to report to probation today.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 9:34

Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.

09:15 AM Defendant Scott Allan Altenburg in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This did not take place. Court event needs to be in court record to dispose of case.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:49 AM Defendant Scott Allan Altenburg does not appear in Court, Atty Alex Stormont, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stormont has not heard anything from his client. DA Hatch is requesting a warrant, Atty Stormont states DE has had a stroke. DA Hatch has no objection to staying a warrant. Court will authorize warrant and stay. Court adjourned ata 9:52 am.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 09:30 am. - Emailed to Jail w/Complaint as Defendant was there to pick up property.  DA's office will also be issuing a Summons.
